description: Jina is the cloud-native neural search solution powered by state-of-the-art AI and deep learning technology

options.help: the workdir for hello-world demo, all data, indices, shards and outputs will be saved there
options.name: workdir

options.help: start a log server for the dashboard
options.name: logserver

options.help: the yaml config of the log server
options.name: logserver_config

options.help: specify the proxy when downloading sample data
options.name: download_proxy

options.help: number of shards when index and query
options.name: shards

options.help: number of parallel when index and query
options.name: parallel

options.help: the yaml path of the index flow
options.name: uses_index

options.help: the url of index data (should be in idx3-ubyte.gz format)
options.name: index_data_url

options.help: the url of index labels data (should be in idx3-ubyte.gz format)
options.name: index_labels_url

options.help: the batch size in indexing
options.name: index_batch_size

options.help: the yaml path of the query flow
options.name: uses_query

options.help: the url of query data (should be in idx3-ubyte.gz format)
options.name: query_data_url

options.help: the url of query labels data (should be in idx3-ubyte.gz format)
options.name: query_labels_url

options.help: the batch size in searching
options.name: query_batch_size

options.help: number of queries to visualize
options.name: num_query

options.help: top-k results to retrieve and visualize
options.name: top_k

options.help: the name of this Pea, used to identify the pea/pod and its logs.
options.name: name

options.help: the yaml config of the logger. note the executor inside will inherit this log config
options.name: log_config

options.help: ==SUPPRESS==
options.name: identity

options.help: ==SUPPRESS==
options.name: log_id

options.help: port for controlling the runtime, default a random port between [49152, 65535]
options.name: port_ctrl

options.help: use ipc protocol for control socket
options.name: ctrl_with_ipc

options.help: timeout (ms) of the control request, -1 for waiting forever
options.name: timeout_ctrl

options.help: the SSH server through which the tunnel will be created, can actually be a fully specified "user@server:port" ssh url.
options.name: ssh_server

options.help: this specifies a key to be used in ssh login, default None. regular default ssh keys will be used without specifying this argument.
options.name: ssh_keyfile

options.help: ssh password to the ssh server.
options.name: ssh_password

options.help: the config of the executor, it could be > a YAML file path, > an executor's class name, > a docker image (must start with docker://)> one of "_pass", "_logforward" > the raw content of YAML config (must starts with "!")
options.name: uses

options.help: the customized python modules need to be imported before loading the executor
options.name: py_modules

options.help: port for input data, default a random port between [49152, 65535]
options.name: port_in

options.help: port for output data, default a random port between [49152, 65535]
options.name: port_out

options.help: host address for input, by default it is 0.0.0.0
options.name: host_in

options.help: host address for output, by default it is 0.0.0.0
options.name: host_out

options.help: socket type for input port
options.name: socket_in

options.help: socket type for output port
options.name: socket_out

options.help: max number of retries when socket is conflict
options.name: max_socket_retries

options.help: serialize the model in the pod every n seconds if model changes. -1 means --read-only.
options.name: dump_interval

options.help: do not allow the pod to modify the model, dump_interval will be ignored
options.name: read_only

options.help: the data and config files are separated for each pea in this pod, only effective when BasePod's `parallel` > 1
options.name: separated_workspace

options.help: memory high watermark of this pod in Gigabytes, pod will restart when this is reached. -1 means no restriction
options.name: memory_hwm

options.help: skip strategy on error message.
options.name: skip_on_error

options.help: ==SUPPRESS==
options.name: num_part

options.help: The executor config that is passed to the docker image if a docker image is used in uses. It cannot be another docker image
options.name: uses_internal

options.help: the entrypoint command overrides the ENTRYPOINT in docker image. when not set then the docker image ENTRYPOINT takes effective.
options.name: entrypoint

options.help: pull the latest image before running
options.name: pull_latest

options.help: the path on the host to be mounted inside the container. if separated by ":" the first part will be considered as the local host path and the second part is the path in the container system. If no split provided, then the basename of that directory will be mounted into container's root path, e.g. --volumes="/user/test/my-workspace" will be mounted into "/my-workspace" inside the container. all volumes are mounted with read-write mode.
options.name: volumes

options.help: host address of the runtime, by default it is 0.0.0.0.
options.name: host

options.help: host port exposed to the public
options.name: port_expose

options.help: the Pea attempts to terminate all of its Runtime child processes/threads on existing. setting it to true basically tell the Pea do not wait on the Runtime when closing
options.name: daemon

options.help: the parallel backend of the runtime inside the pea
options.name: runtime_backend

options.help: the runtime class to run inside the pea
options.name: runtime_cls

options.help: timeout (ms) of a pea waits for the runtime to be ready, -1 for waiting forever
options.name: timeout_ready

options.help: expose the public IP address to remote when necessary, by default it exposesprivate IP address, which only allows accessing under the same network/subnet
options.name: expose_public

options.help: if true then exception stack information to be added to the logging message, useful in debugging
options.name: show_exc_info

options.help: ==SUPPRESS==
options.name: pea_id

options.help: ==SUPPRESS==
options.name: pea_role

options.help: the executor used before sending to all parallels, accepted type follows "--uses"
options.name: uses_before

options.help: the executor used after receiving from all parallels, accepted type follows "--uses"
options.name: uses_after

options.help: number of parallel peas in the pod running at the same time, `port_in` and `port_out` will be set to random, and routers will be added automatically when necessary
options.name: parallel

options.help: ANY: only one (whoever is idle) replica polls the message; ALL: all workers poll the message (like a broadcast)
options.name: polling

options.help: the strategy of scheduling workload among peas
options.name: scheduling

options.help: the way of managing remote runtime
options.name: remote_access

options.help: the way of managing remote runtime
options.name: remote_type

options.help: ==SUPPRESS==
options.name: pod_role

options.help: a yaml file represents a flow
options.name: uses

options.help: start a log server for the dashboard
options.name: logserver

options.help: the yaml config of the log server
options.name: logserver_config

options.help: ==SUPPRESS==
options.name: log_id

options.help: ==SUPPRESS==
options.name: optimize_level

options.help: type of the output
options.name: output_type

options.help: output path of the flow
options.name: output_path

options.help: strategy on those inspect pods in the flow. if REMOVE is given then all inspect pods are removed when building the flow
options.name: inspect

options.name: max_message_size

options.name: proxy

options.name: prefetch

options.name: prefetch_on_recv

options.help: use RESTful interface instead of gRPC as the main interface
options.name: restful

options.name: host

options.name: port_expose

options.name: print_response

options.name: summary_exec

options.name: summary_driver

options.help: if to continue on all requests when callback function throws an error
